TITLE: Time-based OTP Generation and Verification
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create and verify time-based one-time passwords (TOTP) using PyOTP
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyauth/pyotp/blob/main/README.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import pyotp
import time

totp = pyotp.TOTP('base32secret3232')
totp.now() # => '492039'

# OTP verified for current time
totp.verify('492039') # => True
time.sleep(30)
totp.verify('492039') # => False
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Working Example with Google Authenticator
DESCRIPTION: A practical example showing how to generate current OTP using a specific secret key
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyauth/pyotp/blob/main/README.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import pyotp
totp = pyotp.TOTP("JBSWY3DPEHPK3PXP")
print("Current OTP:", totp.now())
```

TITLE: Counter-based OTP Generation and Verification
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create and verify counter-based one-time passwords (HOTP) using PyOTP
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyauth/pyotp/blob/main/README.rst#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import pyotp

hotp = pyotp.HOTP('base32secret3232')
hotp.at(0) # => '260182'
hotp.at(1) # => '055283'
hotp.at(1401) # => '316439'

# OTP verified with a counter
hotp.verify('316439', 1401) # => True
hotp.verify('316439', 1402) # => False
```
